column4: Hello. Is it really that hard to use an nvidia video card with Ubuntu? What do I have to do to install and activate th drivers?
Nvidia drivers usually play pretty nice with Ubuntu...with a clean install you should be able to just download the binary off the Nvidia site and run it
Nvidia site? What’s the nvidia-173 stuff for then?
Ubuntu provides an outdated (yet tested) driver originally from Nvidia...that's what you install when you click the "install proprietary drivers" button
That’s what I did. After installing: How to activate it now?
are you having any specific problems with it?
if you download drivers directly from the nvidia site instead of from the restricted drivers part of Ubuntu, you get drivers that are more up to date and likely to play nice with Ubuntu
do an lsmod for me and link the paste here...http://paste.ubuntu.com/
you might as well also include lspci
http://pastebin.com/NWNNnv2A
what model Nvidia card are you using?  It seems to have the AGP driver loaded for some reason
Doesn’t the lspci part of the paste tell you?
I see it now...missed it at first
that is a VERY old card
Ok, how to use it?
hmm, it should be supported...honestly, it looks like the driver is already in use and you don't need to do anything else
(EE) NVIDIA(0): Failed to load the NVIDIA kernel module!
I'm afraid I don't have any ideas...I trust you've already done the appropriate googling for this
if you haven't seen it already, this might help...http://phun-ky.net/2008/10/fix-for-failed-to-load-the-nvidia-kernel-module-on-ubuntu
you might also have an issue if your xorg.conf that breaks it...have you tried nvidia-xconfig?
Yes, I also ran nvidia-xconfig before.

I meant viruses from an unmounted partition can't jump out unless that partition gets mounted...for the nvidia card problem, I don't have any more ideas...I'm a little disappointed since nvidia usually works much better
